intro: Falcatula falsotrifolium, commonly known as false shamrock, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically forms dense mats and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often overlooked member of the understory flora.
